title: Requires utility corporations and entities to submit an annual report to the public service commission, the legislature, the executive and the chairman of the state
summary: Requires utility corporations and entities to submit an annual report to the public service commission, legislature, the executive, and the chairman of the state energy planning board detailing energy metering production, including the number of customer-generators, the type of power producing the energy and the amount of output from each customer-generator.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1765

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  PERKINS, DUANE -- read twice and ordered printed,
         and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Energy and  Tele-
         communications

       AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to requiring utility
         corporations  and  entities  to  submit an annual report to the public
         service commission, the legislature, the executive and the chairman of
         the state energy planning board detailing energy metering production

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The public service law is amended by adding a new section
    2  66-m to read as follows:
    3    S 66-M. REPORTING TO THE COMMISSION, THE  LEGISLATURE,  THE  EXECUTIVE
    4  AND  THE  CHAIRMAN  OF THE STATE ENERGY PLANNING BOARD BY UTILITY CORPO-
    5  RATIONS AND ENTITIES. 1.   ANY UTILITY CORPORATION  OR  ENTITY  ENTERING
    6  INTO CONTRACTS OR ENGAGING IN THE SALE OR TRADE OF ENERGY METERING SHALL
    7  FILE  WITH THE COMMISSION, THE LEGISLATURE, THE EXECUTIVE AND THE CHAIR-
    8  MAN OF THE STATE ENERGY PLANNING BOARD AN ANNUAL REPORT AT  A  TIME  AND
    9  COVERING  THE YEARLY PERIOD FIXED BY THE COMMISSION DETAILING THE ENERGY
   10  METERING AND INTERCONNECTION BETWEEN THE UTILITY AND THEIR CUSTOMER-GEN-
   11  ERATORS, THE TYPE OF GENERATING EQUIPMENT PRODUCING AND PROVIDING ENERGY
   12  TO THE UTILITY CORPORATION OR ENTITY,  AND  THE  NET  AMOUNT  OF  ENERGY
   13  PRODUCED BY EACH CUSTOMER-GENERATOR.  SUCH REPORT SHALL CONTAIN INFORMA-
   14  TION  DETAILING  THE  AMOUNT  OF  DISTRIBUTED  ENERGY SOURCES WITHIN THE
   15  SERVICE TERRITORY OF ANY UTILITY CORPORATION  OR  ENTITY  ENTERING  INTO
   16  CONTRACTS  OR ENGAGING IN THE SALE OR TRADE OF DISTRIBUTED ENERGY SOURC-
   17  ES, THE ANNUAL AMOUNT OF ENERGY PRODUCED BY SUCH RESOURCES, THE TYPE  OF
   18  FUEL  USED, AND INFORMATION ON BACKUP FUEL SYSTEMS. SUCH REPORT SHALL BE
   19  DELIVERED DIRECTLY TO THE CHAIR OF  THE  CORPORATIONS,  AUTHORITIES  AND
   20  COMMISSIONS  COMMITTEE  IN THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY, THE RANKING MINORITY
   21  MEMBER OF THE CORPORATIONS, AUTHORITIES AND COMMISSIONS COMMITTEE IN THE
   22  SENATE AND ASSEMBLY, THE CHAIR  OF  THE  ENERGY  AND  TELECOMMUNICATIONS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06894-01-1

       S. 1765                             2

    1  COMMITTEE  IN  THE SENATE, THE RANKING MINORITY MEMBER OF THE ENERGY AND
    2  TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMMITTEE IN THE SENATE,  THE  CHAIR  OF  THE  ENERGY
    3  COMMITTEE  IN  THE  ASSEMBLY,  THE RANKING MINORITY MEMBER OF THE ENERGY
    4  COMMITTEE  IN THE ASSEMBLY, THE CHAIR OF THE RENEWABLE ENERGY SUBCOMMIT-
    5  TEE IN THE ASSEMBLY AND THE RANKING MINORITY  MEMBER  OF  THE  RENEWABLE
    6  ENERGY SUBCOMMITTEE IN THE ASSEMBLY.
    7    2.  FOR  THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "CUSTOMER-GENERATOR" SHALL MEAN
    8  ANY CUSTOMER CLASS OF A UTILITY CORPORATION, INCLUDING BUT  NOT  LIMITED
    9  TO  RESIDENTIAL  AND  COMMERCIAL, THAT IS INTERCONNECTED TO THE ELECTRIC
   10  GRID SYSTEM AND IS PRODUCING ENERGY ON SITE.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to requiring utility corporations and entities to submit an annual report to the public service commission, the legislature, the executive and the chairman of the state energy planning board detailing energy metering production
